The metric chosen to evaluate the accuracy of the inversion models of phytoplankton pigment concentrations is the determination coefficient. The determination coefficient, also known as R-squared (R^2), measures the proportion of the variance in the dependent variable (phytoplankton pigment concentrations) that can be explained by the independent variables (fluorescence excitation spectra). 

The determination coefficient can range from 0 to 1, where 0 indicates that the independent variables have no explanatory power, and 1 indicates a perfect fit between the independent and dependent variables. In the study, the inversion model of the total chlorophyll a has the highest accuracy with a determination coefficient of 0.87. 

The determination coefficient provides a measure of how well the inversion models can predict the phytoplankton pigment concentrations based on the fluorescence excitation spectra.
